Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/30/2024, two staff members grabbed a youth and threw her
out of the unit.
Investigation Interview:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on October 2, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A said on Monday,
September 30, 2024, she was attempting to get into unit three to
see another youth when Staff 1 “grabbed” her and “threw” her out
of the unit. Youth A said she cannot remember how she landed but
that she became very upset and “swung” on Staff 1. Youth A said
Staff 1 and Staff 2 then placed her into a standing restraint. Youth
A denied being hurt from this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on October 10, 2024.
Staff 1 said on Monday, September 30, 2024, Youth A was sent off
campus for an appointment during which time staff searched her
items and moved another youth off her unit. Staff 1 said when
Youth A returned to the unit, she was confronted about the
contraband she had in her belongings and told the other youth
was moved off her unit. Staff 1 said Youth A did not seem to
respond or care about the search or contraband being found but
was very upset by her peer moving to another unit. Staff 1 said
Youth A started to pace up and down the sidewalk outside of the
unit doors with her fists balled up. Staff 1 said Staff 2 was Youth
A’s one-on-one and was allowing her to pace and giving her space
when Youth A stopped at her peer’s unit door, took out a key, and
began to unlock the unit door. Staff 1 said Youth A is not allowed in
the unit for safety plans with two of the youth that were in that unit.
Staff 1 said Staff 2 was attempting to stop Youth A and get the key
when she was able to open the door, turned sideways, and was
sliding through the opened door into the unit she is not allowed to
be in. Staff 1 said he used the “turn away technique” and took
2

Youth A by her elbows and turned her away from him and out of
the unit and shut the door. Staff 1 said Youth A was upset and
became assaultive towards him, so he and Staff 2 placed her in a
standing restraint, with each of them on either side of Youth A
holding her by the arms. Staff 1 said while in the restraint Staff 2
was able to get the key out of Youth A’s hand. Staff 1 said Youth A
eventually calmed down and was released.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on November 12, 2024.
Staff 2 said Youth A was upset that her peer had been moved out
of her unit and was walking up and down the sidewalk. Staff 2 said
Youth A stopped in front of the unit that her peer was in and pulled
a key out of her bra and began to open the door. Staff 2 said he
and Staff 1 stood in front of the door trying to remove the key from
Youth A’s hand however she was still able to get the door unlocked
and pushed Staff 1 and got into the unit. Staff 2 said Staff 1 used
his “body” to get her out of the unit. Staff 2 said it may have been
an attempted lever technique however looked more like he just
used his body weight to get her back out of the doorway. Staff 2
denied Youth A falling or getting injured from the restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on October 10, 2024.
Staff 3 reported she is Wolverine Human Service’s restraint
trainer. Staff 3 said she viewed the video footage of Staff 1 with
Youth A outside of unit three on Monday, September 30, 2024.
Staff 3 said she trains the staff to use CPI for all physical
interventions. Staff 3 said Staff 1 used the “lever” technique when
moving Youth A out of the door and away from the unit. Staff 3
said staff are trained to take youth’s arms and turn them away or
to the place they need to be. Staff 3 said the video clip is very fast
however after reviewing it several times she felt it was done per
the trained technique as Staff 1 had taken Youth A’s elbows and
turned her out of the unit.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of September 30, 2024, unit three was reviewed on
October 10, 2024. The video is ten seconds in length. Unit three
door opens slightly, and Youth A’s arm is seen on the door as she
is moving into the unit past Staff 1. As Youth A attempts to get into
the unit Staff 1 has ahold of the back of her shirt. Youth A gets into
the door way and Staff 2 is seen opening the door the rest of the
way while Staff 1 is seen reaching around Youth A’s waist and
pulling her backwards through the door. Staff 1’s left harm moves
to Youth A’s forearm or wrist and his right arm goes from around
her waist to her back as he turns her away from the doorway. Staff
2 closes the door.
3

Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed CPI training on 6/19/24.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 completed CPI training on
6/19/24.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report 196130240 date 9/30/24: This
documented Youth A’s attempt to enter a unit, but no
specifics on staff intervening to get her out of the unit, and
then details the restraint that took place outside the unit.
• The CPI Safety interventions Disengagement Skills
workbook “Turning Away: Lever” information was reviewed.
The “Key Points” are as follows:
o Begin in your Supportive Stance, standing close,
behind the person.
o Place your hand nearest to the person under their
arm, holding their shoulder as close as possible.
o Place your hand furthest from the person behind the
other shoulder.
o Apply the Lever principle by stepping back with the
foot closest to the person.
o Hold the person’s shoulders as close as possible as
you prompt them to turn.
o Move your hands from the person’s shoulders and
apply the Hold and Stabilize principle to their elbows.
o Guide the person to a place of safety.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per Youth A and Staff
2’s interviews, documentation, and video review, staff did not
utilize the approved technique when removing Youth A from the
unit doorway.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000117 dated 3/7/2023, CAP Approved 3/28/2023
SIR 2023C0000039 dated 5/12/2023, CAP Approved 6/29/2023

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
